channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AL

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DURING THE UNLOAD PROCESS EMPLOYEE NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS DAMP AND CALLED FOR RESPONDER. RESPONDER WAS NOTIFIED, DONNED PPE, AND TRANSPORTED TO DMP FOR PROCESSING.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was unloaded from trailer and placed on rollers upside down. Liquid leaked from the tops and corroded the box. DescribePack: There was a hole burned through the top of the box. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was sat up right inside of a hazardous bin. None leaked on outside of box.

item.title: Report X-2023030727
item.description:
Report X-2023030727

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-03T13:57:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-13
  • City: TUSCALOOSA
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Was loaded improperly & pulled from the trap trailer; package handler unloaded the package that resulted in the cause of the slight leakage. DescribePack: Loose caps on bottles inside the package caused leakage, substance burned packaging. Holes were half the size of the package, almost whole top of box disintegrated. Hazmat was already contained inside of tote. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Put inside of tote to ensure no further leakage was contained.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Driver had the package on the truck and when he came back he notified QA about a leaking package in his truck. QA placed the placed the package in a hazmat container for further inspection. DescribePack: Small pin size hole on the base of the neck of the plastic bottle. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Driver notified QA about the package when he came back to the terminal and QA placed it into a hazmat container.

item.title: Report I-2023030007
item.description:
Report I-2023030007

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-03T13:57:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-20
  • City: Pinson
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PENN TANK LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Product was being pumped from a tanker trailer to an above ground storage tank. Too much product was pumped into the tank resulting in a spill of approximately 100 gallons of diesel fuel. Driver immediately shit down the delivery. HEPACO environmental cleanup was dispatched to the scene for the cleanup. Approximately 5 cubic yards of oil dry compound was collected along with soil along the edge of the pavement that was impacted. There was no police, fire, or EMS dispatched to the scene

item.title: Report E-2023030300
item.description:
Report E-2023030300

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-03T13:57:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-23
  • City: BESSEMER
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NMP experienced a release from (3) 50-pound poly bags of UN2680 Lithium Hydroxide Monohydrate. The bags were ripped as a result of improper loading. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 3-pounds of product released to a 6' x 3" area of the trailer floor due to being torn against the trailer wall. The three damaged bags and all released product were containerized into 1 30-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one case of thinner (un1263) had been damaged by a sharp object and that 2 of the inner metal one gallon cans had released 0.25 gallons of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

Report X-2023021014

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-21
  • City: MONTGOMERY
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO PACKAGE WEARING PROPER PPE AND DECISION TREE. PACKAGE LEAKING UPON BELT AND EMITTING A STRONG FUME. USING DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET; CONTAINED THE LEAKER AND TRANSPORTED TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2023020497
item.description:
Report E-2023020497

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-03T13:57:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-24
  • City: BESSEMER
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal NBM experienced a release of UN1805 Bonderite C-AK 305 Alkaline Cleaner known as Parco Cleaner 305 from a 55-gallon poly drum due to a forklift puncture. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 15-gallons of product released to a 30' x 6' area of the concrete dock floor due to a pinhole puncture. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. All impacted absorbents and neutralizer were collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

QA placed package in hazardous tote and brought to cage for further inspection. DescribePack: One of 12 bottles closure were open and off the bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Driver found package on truck and informed QA immediately. QA placed package in hazardous tote and brought to cage for further inspection.

  • City: BIRMINGHAM

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found on trailer damaged. Package was loaded on its side with the arrows pointing sideways and packages were stacked on top of the package. DescribePack: Package had corrosion damage on top corner of box possibly due to pressure being put on box causing one of the bottles spilling some liquid. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Not enough spilled to make it outside of the box. Caps were still on the bottles. Package was isolated and put in a hazardous bin.
